title: VPNs: Privacy Shield or False Promise?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: VPNs: Privacy Shield or False Promise?.

hook.text: VPN ads promise total anonymity. In reality, you're shifting trust from your ISP to the VPN company â€“ which may.

buildup.text: A VPN encrypts your traffic and masks your IP. Your ISP can't see what you browse, but your VPN provider can.

discovery.text: Many 'no-log' VPN providers have been caught keeping logs. Some have handed user data to law enforcement when pressured.

twist.text: Seven 'no-log' VPN providers based in Hong Kong leaked 1.2TB of user data in 2020 â€“ including browsing history.

climax.text: VPNs are useful but not magic. They're one tool in a privacy toolkit, not a complete solution.

quiz.question: Why should users be cautious about VPN 'no-log' claims?
options: Multiple 'no-log' providers have been caught keeping and leaking user data
